title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Instructional Design for Virtual Physics Laboratory

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced physics theory and basic experimental knowledge, with digital tool proficiency
context.additional_context: Emphasizes the design capability of virtual laboratories applicable to real-world tasks for current practitioners

learning_goals: Explain the design principles of virtual physics laboratories based on cognitive load theory
Propose interface design solutions that consider learners' working memory capacity when designing various physics experiment modules

Learners develop a virtual laboratory prototype reflecting real vocational training environments (e.g., electrical/electronics labs) with at least three core functions (experiment simulation, data logging, error diagnosis), achieving over 80% suitability scores in peer and expert reviews to pass project-based assessment
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
